 CONCORDIA LIFESTYLE 
 Energy. Style. Social engagement. The  joie de vivre  as a student in Montreal. Montreal is one of the world’s great cities – and the very  best student city in the world  – with a lifestyle that’s affordable, stimulating and fun.             
 Sports and fitness Concordia’s exceptional facilities make it easy to stay in shape. And if there’s a sport you’re interested in, chances are good you’ll find it here – we’ve even got rock climbing, dragon boating, hurling and Gaelic football, snowshoeing, skiing and snowboarding. Our Stingers compete in hockey, football, rugby, basketball, soccer and wrestling.  Explore sports & fitness options  All about the stingers 
 Housing A built-in social life. Instant friends from around the world. A hop, skip and a jump away from class, the gym, and the library. Your new neighbourhood: Quartier Concordia, in the heart of downtown Montreal. Or, live at Loyola, a historic, gorgeous campus with a tight-knit community. 
 Grey Nuns Residence  Sir George Williams Campus Learn more 
 Hingston Hall and the Jesuit Residence Loyola Campus Learn more 
 Clubs and associations Some of the most memorable moments of your university years could turn out to be time spent with others on activities and projects that are important, powerful, and educational –or simply tonnes of fun. Student life at Concordia encompasses an inspiring range of opportunities.  Things to do beyond the classroom 
 A cultural scene  sans pareil At Concordia, we’re fuelled by creativity and diversity, just like the city around us. People from all over the world live, work and create here. That makes for an incredibly rich experience when it comes to language, literature, fashion, music, film, and food. Living in Montreal will open your eyes – and your mind. Learn more
